initial_error.root_cause: Missing import in entities.py - COLOR_PLAYER and COLOR_PLAYER_ACCEL are defined in config.py but not imported in entities.py

startup_test.fix_applied: Added COLOR_PLAYER and COLOR_PLAYER_ACCEL to the import statement in entities.py lines 4-10
startup_test.window_title: Vector Super Mario Bros Jump and Dash Pro

tests_performed.details: Game window opens with proper resolution and title. Background renders with sky blue color (135, 170, 200) and parallax cloud effects.
Red rectangle (24x32 pixels) renders with direction indicator (eye) and acceleration indicator (yellow circle when running).
Left/Right Arrow keys control player movement with momentum-based acceleration system. Speed builds up over time when holding direction keys.
Spacebar triggers jump with variable height based on key-hold duration. Initial jump force of -13.0 with additional -0.5 force for up to 15 frames.
Gravity (0.6), terminal velocity (12.0), friction (0.85), and acceleration (0.4) all working correctly.
Player lands on platforms, hits from below, and collides from sides. Proper collision resolution implemented.
Camera smoothly follows player with lerp interpolation (0.1 factor). Clamped to level bounds.
HUD displays Score, Distance, and Attempts. Control hints shown at start. Win overlay displayed on goal reach.
Game loop runs stably at 60 FPS. Handles QUIT event and ESC key for clean exit.

platforms.quantity: Multiple platforms including starting ground, elevated sections, and staircase

spikes.behavior: Kills player on contact with smaller hitbox for fairness

issues_found.description: Missing imports in entities.py prevented initial launch

code_quality_assessment.file_structure: Good separation of concerns (main.py, game.py, entities.py, config.py)
code_quality_assessment.documentation: Docstrings present for classes and methods
code_quality_assessment.ai_integration: get_state() method available for AI agent integration with normalized observation space

observations: Game successfully creates window and renders all entities
Physics feel responsive with momentum system
Variable jump height allows for precision platforming
Camera follows player smoothly without jitter
HUD provides clear feedback to player
Game loop is stable with no memory leaks observed
Proper cleanup on exit (pygame.quit() and sys.exit())
recommendations: Consider adding sound effects for jumping, dying, and winning
Could benefit from a main menu or start screen
Consider adding particle effects for visual feedback
Consider adding a time trial mode
summary: After fixing the missing import bug (COLOR_PLAYER and COLOR_PLAYER_ACCEL), the game runs successfully. All basic functionality works as intended including player movement with momentum, variable jump height, platform collision, spike hazards, pits, goal detection, scoring system, and camera following. The game is stable and ready for play or AI agent training.
